# Modification of the King Weather Radar Tower
## Description of the Work
The following statement of work outlines the requirements to modify the existing C-band weather radar tower at the King Weather Radar Site in King City, Ontario. The work aims to shorten the tower, which has had the radar and radome removed, and includes:

* Shortening the existing C-band tower to approximately 20.5m above ground level
* Installation of a new extended deck on the shortened tower
* Building of a new structure and extended deck on the shortened tower
* Relocation of the existing power distribution box to a new supporting structure
* Modification of the existing spiral staircase
* Installation of a new davit crane and safety rails on the new extended deck
* Installation of a lightning protection system and tie-down points on the new extended deck
* Modification of the chain link fence surrounding the radar
* Inspection of the tower at completion and performance of any necessary maintenance or repairs

## Important Information
* This is a two-phase competition. Phase one will evaluate the qualifications of all bidders, while phase two will invite qualified bidders to provide a financial bid on the project.
* The pre-qualification list resulting from phase one will expire upon award of a contract in phase two and will not be used in any other solicitation.
* Delivery of the project must be completed within 8 weeks from the date of notification of acceptance of the offer.
* The estimated value of the project is between $100,000.00 and $300,000.00 (taxes excluded).
